alert.note: Alert for Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 9:15AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Washington, northwestern Tyler and northeastern Wood Counties through 945 AM EST... At 914 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marietta, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and up to pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Middlebourne, Williamstown, Paden City, Sistersville, Boaz, Matamoras, Lowell, Friendly, Fly, Lower Salem, New Matamoras and Devola. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 185 and 186. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
